prompt: Agile vs. Waterfall methodologies: Which suits modern development better?

criteria.name: Understanding of Methodologies
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of Agile and Waterfall development methodologies.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Thoroughly explains Agile and Waterfall principles, phases, strengths, and weaknesses.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes both methodologies and their main characteristics.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions both methodologies with limited detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of one or both methodologies.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to explain Agile or Waterfall.

criteria.name: Evaluation for Modern Development
criteria.description: Assesses which methodology is better suited for modern software projects.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully compares both, with context on adaptability, collaboration, and market demands.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains which methodology is generally better and why.
performance_descriptors.average: Makes a general preference statement with limited reasoning.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Provides examples of each methodology used in real projects.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one appropriate example for each methodology.
performance_descriptors.average: Examples are mentioned but not explained.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains Agile (iterative, adaptive) and Waterfall (linear, sequential) in detail
Compares flexibility, customer feedback, and risk management
Real-world examples: Agile at Spotify, Scrum at Microsoft, Waterfall in construction/defense
llm_questions: How does Waterfall differ from Agile?
Why is Agile popular in modern software development?
Can you provide real-world examples of Agile and Waterfall in use?
What are the main strengths and weaknesses of both?
